title: 103_hr58
content: The Act may be cited as the "Merchant Marine Memorial Enhancement Act of 1993". Conveyance vessels are addressed in the Act. The Secretary of Transportation has the authority to convey two vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations that operate and maintain Liberty Ships or Victory Ships as memorials to merchant mariners. The vessels must be at least 4,000 displacement tons, have no usefulness to the Government, and be scheduled for scrapping. Organizations receiving the vessels must enter into an agreement with the Secretary before the conveyance. Conditions of Conveyance: Before conveying a vessel to an organization, the Secretary must require the organization to sell the vessel for scrap, use the proceeds to refurbish a memorial ship, and return any unused proceeds to the United States. The Secretary must convey vessels to organizations under the condition that they sell the vessel for scrap, use the proceeds to refurbish a memorial ship, and return any unused proceeds to the United States. Amounts returned will be deposited in the Vessel Operations Revolving Fund. Vessels will be delivered at their location and condition on the date of approval without cost to the Government. The authority to convey vessels expires 2 years after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. DOCUMENTATION OF VESSELS. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for specific vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for specific vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers: BRANDARIS, COMPASS ROSE, DIXIE, ELISSA, EMERALD PRINCESS, ENTERPRISE, EUROPA STAR, EUROPA SUN, GAZELA OF PHILADELPHIA, GRAY, GRIZZLY PROCESSOR, GUSTO, GYPSY COWBOY. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels with coastwise endorsement, including various vessels like ISLAND GIRL, JULIET, KALENA, LAURISA, LIBBY ROSE, LISERON, MARINE STAR, MARINER, and MARY B. The vessels listed with official numbers and registration numbers include LISERON, MARINE STAR, MARINER, MARY B, MOONSHINE, MYSTIQUE, NORTHERN LIGHT, PAI NUI, PANDACEA, PELICAN, PLAY PRETTY, PRINCE OF TIDES II, RBOAT, and SABLE. The vessels listed with official numbers and registration numbers include PLAY PRETTY, PRINCE OF TIDES II, RBOAT, SABLE, SERENA, SHILOH, SIDEWINDER, SWELL DANCER, TESSA, TOP DUCK, VIKING, and WHIT CON TIKI. Foreign-flag vessel H851 is authorized to engage in coastwise trade to transport an offshore drilling platform jacket from Texas to Viosca Knoll 989. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates for vessels LADY CHARL II and LINETTE for coastwise and Great Lakes trade. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels LADY CHARL II and LINETTE with coastwise and Great Lakes endorsements. Additionally, the Secretary may issue a certificate for vessel M/V TWIN DRILL with a coastwise endorsement after a major conversion in a U.S. shipyard costing more than 3 times the vessel's purchase value. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels LADY CHARL II and LINETTE with coastwise and Great Lakes endorsements. Additionally, a certificate may be issued for vessel M/V TWIN DRILL after a major conversion in a U.S. shipyard costing more than 3 times the vessel's purchase value, with the condition of constructing an additional vessel of equal or greater capacity within a specified timeframe. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels REEL CLASS, DA WARRIOR, UST ATLANTIC, and UST PACIFIC with specific endorsements, despite certain regulations and agreements. The vessels UST ATLANTIC and UST PACIFIC can be sold to non-US citizens and transferred to a foreign registry. The vessel AMY CHOUEST is considered to be less than 500 gross tons for US maritime laws. The Secretary of Commerce may deploy a Physical Ocean Real-Time System in Galveston Bay and the Houston Ship Channel for nautical charting and marine safety improvements. The Secretary of Transportation will establish a 3-year pilot program for Sealift Training at the Massachusetts Maritime Academy.
